title: About
text:
This is the about page.
It’s stored as ‘about.qmd’ in the root directory of the FinalProject378Durocher project, which just means that it’s in the same folder.
I’m still learning how to make a Quarto website.
Here are some useful commands:

title: Penguins EDA
text:
Code
library(palmerpenguins)
library(dplyr)



Attaching package: 'dplyr'


The following objects are masked from 'package:stats':

    filter, lag


The following objects are masked from 'package:base':

    intersect, setdiff, setequal, union


Code
library(dbplyr)



Attaching package: 'dbplyr'


The following objects are masked from 'package:dplyr':

    ident, sql


Code
library(ggplot2)
library(duckdb)


Loading required package: DBI


Code
library(vctrs)



Attaching package: 'vctrs'


The following object is masked from 'package:dplyr':

    data_frame


Code
library(DBI)

con <- DBI::dbConnect(duckdb::duckdb(), dbdir = "my-db.duckdb")
DBI::dbWriteTable(con, "penguins", palmerpenguins::penguins,overwrite = TRUE)

df <- dplyr::tbl(con, "penguins")




Code
df %>%
  group_by(species, sex) %>%
  summarise(
    across(
        ends_with("mm") | ends_with("g"),
      \(x) mean(x, na.rm = TRUE)
      ), .groups = "drop"
    ) %>%
  dplyr::collect() %>% 
  knitr::kable()

title: Penguins EDA
section: Penguin Size vs Mass by Species
text:
Penguin Size vs Mass by Species


Code
df %>%
  ggplot(aes(x = bill_length_mm, y = body_mass_g, color = species)) +
  geom_point() + 
  geom_smooth(method = "lm")


`geom_smooth()` using formula = 'y ~ x'


Warning: Removed 2 rows containing non-finite outside the scale range
(`stat_smooth()`).


Warning: Removed 2 rows containing missing values or values outside the scale range
(`geom_point()`).

title: FinalProject378Durocher
text:
This is a Quarto website.
The file associated with this page is ‘index.qmd’
To learn more about Quarto websites visit https://quarto.org/docs/websites.
Look, I can run code and have it appear in the website!

1 + 1

[1] 2

title: Model
text:
Code
import duckdb
from palmerpenguins import penguins
from pandas import get_dummies
import numpy as np
from sklearn.linear_model import LinearRegression
from sklearn import preprocessing

title: Model
text:
Get Data


Code
con = duckdb.connect('my-db.duckdb')
df = penguins.load_penguins()
con.register('df',df)
con.execute('CREATE TABLE penguins AS SELECT * FROM df')
con.close()




Code
df = penguins.load_penguins().dropna()

df.head(3)

title: Model
text:
Define Model and Fit


Code
X = get_dummies(df[['bill_length_mm', 'species', 'sex']], drop_first = True)
y = df['body_mass_g']

model = LinearRegression().fit(X, y)

title: Model
text:
Get some information


Code
print(f"R^2 {model.score(X,y)}")
print(f"Intercept {model.intercept_}")
print(f"Columns {X.columns}")
print(f"Coefficients {model.coef_}")


R^2 0.8555368759537614
Intercept 2169.2697209393973
Columns Index(['bill_length_mm', 'species_Chinstrap', 'species_Gentoo', 'sex_male'], dtype='object')
Coefficients [  32.53688677 -298.76553447 1094.86739145  547.36692408]

title: Model
section: turn our model into a Vetiver model and save it to /data/model
text:
turn our model into a Vetiver model and save it to /data/model


Code
from vetiver import VetiverModel
v = VetiverModel(model, model_name='penguin_model', prototype_data=X)




Code
from vetiver import vetiver_pin_write
from vetiver import VetiverAPI
import pins




Code
b = pins.board_folder('data/model', allow_pickle_read=True)
vetiver_pin_write(b,v,'penguin_model')
v = VetiverModel.from_pin(b, 'penguin_model')


Model Cards provide a framework for transparent, responsible reporting. 
 Use the vetiver `.qmd` Quarto template as a place to start, 
 with vetiver.model_card()

Name: 'penguin_model'
